sub_title: Postdoctoral Researcher at University of Amsterdam
summary: Edith van Ewijk (Dr.) is a post-doc researcher attached to the research project: 'Stepping Out: Accelerating deep transdisciplinary and interprofessional learning for innovative actions, interventions and strategies of deep sustainable transitions in port area development'. The project is led by Prof. P.W. Chan and will be carried out in close collaboration with the Centre for Urban Studies - University of Amsterdam, Hogeschool Rotterdam and collaboration partners in Rotterdam and Amsterdam Harbour areas. The project is funded by NWO, Transitions and Behaviour call.

profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher at University of Amsterdam

profile_positions.description:
As postdoc researcher I am attached to the Faculty of Architecture and the Built Environment, Department of Management in the Built Environment. 
Title of the research project: Stepping Out: Accelerating deep transdisciplinary and interprofessional learning for innovative actions, interventions and strategies of deep sustainable transitions in port area development.
The research project is led by Prof. P.W. Chan and will be carried out in close collaboration with the Centre for Urban Studies - University of Amsterdam, Hogeschool Rotterdam and collaboration partners in Rotterdam and Amsterdam Harbour areas. The project is funded by NWO, Transitions and Behaviour call.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: The postdoc focuses on knowledge brokering and learning in Food & Business Knowledge platforms in The Netherlands, Ghana and South Africa and is financed by NWO-WOTRO. The project is led by Mirjam Ros-Tonen of the University of Amsterdam, Dept. of Geography, Planning and International Development Studies (Governance and Inclusive Development group). The project received a budget neutral extension until January 2021 and some of the project publications will still be published.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

company.name: Wereld in Woorden/ WiW Global Research & Reporting

profile_positions.description: WiW- Global Research and Reporting writes and executes research on global issues, international cooperation and sustainable development: www.wereldinwoorden.nl
profile_positions.title: Researcher/ textwriter

profile_positions.description: As senior researcher I exceuted policy and evaluation research focusing on international cooperation and sustainable development. Key topics included: Sustainable Development Goals, Aid & Trade agenda, Sexual and Reproductive Health & Rights, local governance, land governance and migration.
profile_positions.title: Senior onderzoeker internationale samenwerking

profile_positions.description: Dissertation Between Local Governments and Communities - knowledge exchange and mutual learning in Dutch-Moroccan and Dutch- Turkish municipal partnerships
profile_positions.title: Dr.

profile_positions.description: Various assignment on international cooperation, urban development and local governance. SNV, Forum, former Habitat Platform e.o.
profile_positions.title: Freelance researcher and text writer

profile_positions.description: The Dutch Habitat Platform was initiated by the Dutch Government in 1998, after the United Nations Conference on Human Settlements (Habitat II) in Istanbul (1996). The platform was operational till 2007. The Dutch Habitat Platform supported and connected partners working on issues related to habitat. In 2002 the Dutch Habitat Platform received the UN Habitat Scroll of Honour.
profile_positions.title: Policy advisor

profile_positions.description:
JAMABA stands for ‘Jamii na Mazingira Baringo’, ‘the people and the environment Baringo’.  As a JPO I was involved in; the supervision and advice on soil and water conservation and income generating activities, the organization of training sessions and the coordination of field
 and research activities.
profile_positions.title: Junior Professional Officer JAMABA project

profile_positions.description:
I was involved in the monitoring of program activities in district Busia, Kenya and in the 
Coordination  and supervision of evaluation studies in three other districts in Kenya (Migori,
 Uasin Gishu and Kericho).
profile_positions.title: Program officer ‘Kenya Woodfuel and Agroforestry Programme’
